content: pattern only in danish can also be found for free at familie journal - strik marys royale svøp 2 the original 1950 s pattern was published by monarch yarn as cute n cozy shawl it may have used a us 8 needle gauge is not known and is not critical unless you want an exact 60 square --- this is marianne knorborg s translation of the shawl used by crown princess mary of denmark recently for bringing both of her newborns home from the hospital the original is a shetland lace design svøbet er strikket efter en opskrift fra shetlandsøerne fra 1800-tallet og i skotland hvor marys forældre stammer fra bruges disse sjaler stadig både som babysvøb og som sjaler til kvinder i alle aldre http //www familiejournal dk/handarbejde/strik%20til%20born/2009_33_marys_svoeb aspx materials as listed in the pattern > materialer 400 gram tyndt uldgarn med en løbelængde på ca 200 m/50 g http //markno dk/shop/6829-opskrifter-paa-royale-svoeb/15316-marysvoebet---det-hele-kongerige/ in english that s 400g thin wool yarn with a ratio of approximately 200m per 50g but you can knit this up in any yarn - from 1 ply lace to double knit this is a traditional shetland hap shawl the danish pattern is likely a translation of an english pattern abjoerge s chart can be found here 5 1 http //markno dk/shop/6829-opskrifter-paa-royale-svoeb/15316-marysvoebet---det-hele-kongerige/ 2 http //www familiejournal dk/handarbejde/strik-til-born/2010-40-strikkeopskirft-royalt-svoeb aspx 3 http //craftfreely-com securec23 ezhostingserver com/free-knitting-patterns/preview-pattern cfm id=4536 5 https //drive google com/file/d/0bxugwpncnrltmtk3njk1ngetmmzlyy00ngnllthmnditn2u1njbiogi4yzi0/edit usp=sharing&authkey=cnlvrtyp
